summary: This bill, the Ralph David Abernathy, Sr., National Historic Site Act, proposes to establish a National Historic Site in Georgia to preserve and interpret the historic West Hunter Street Baptist Church and the role of Reverend Dr. Abernathy as a civil rights leader. The Secretary of the Interior is tasked with establishing the site, defining its boundary based on a specific map, acquiring land, and developing a management plan. The Secretary can enter agreements with other entities for interpretive services. The site aims to benefit future generations by preserving this significant location and leader of the Civil Rights movement.
